description: Borrowed from Okinawan Japanese 双節棍 (nunchaku), probably from Min Nan 兩節棍／两节棍 (nn̄g-chat-kùn, literally “two-segment cudgel”), from 兩／两 (nn̄g, “two”) + 節／节 (chat, “joint; link; segment”) + 棍 (kùn, “cudgel; stick”).

nouns.description: nunchaku (countable and uncountable, plural nunchakus) (martial arts, weaponry)

entries.meaning: (countable) A weapon originating from Okinawa, Japan, consisting of two sticks joined by a chain or cord. [from 20th c.]
examples: Synonyms: chainsticks, numchuck, num-chuk, nunchuck, nunchuk

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The skill of using this weapon in martial arts.
